intro: Pyramidanthe tiwiensis, commonly known as the Tiwi pyramidanthe, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pyramidal-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in the Northern Territory and Western Australia. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it is often found in coastal or near-coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
